TextEquiv.Unicode: McDonald's to change what it's made of, removes unhealthy ingredients
NEW YORK, N.Y. — McDonald's is trying to convince people
it does not servejunk food. The fast food chain said Monday it
will no longer make some of its food with certain chemicals and

NEW YORK, N.Y. — McDonald's is trying to convince people it does not servejunk food. The fast food chain said Monday it will no longer make some of its food with certain chemicals and other ingredients.
It said that Chicken McNuggets and other foods will be made
without artificial preservatives. These are chemicals that keep
food from spoiling. It will also take out high-fructose corn
syrup from its burger buns. High-fructose corn syrup is a sweet-
ener made from corn. Health experts say it is not healthy and

It said that Chicken McNuggets and other foods will be made without artificial preservatives. These are chemicals that keep food from spoiling. It will also take out high-fructose corn syrup from its burger buns. High-fructose corn syrup is a sweet- ener made from corn. Health experts say it is not healthy and makes people overweight.
McDonald's is the world's biggest burger chain. It is ﬁghting to
get back customers. For the third straight year, fewer people are
eating at McDonald's restaurants in the United States.
McDonald's is the world's biggest burger chain. It is ﬁghting to get back customers. For the third straight year, fewer people are eating at McDonald's restaurants in the United States.
Mike Andres is president ofMcDonald's U.S. If customers do
not want these ingredients, he said McDonald's should get rid
Mike Andres is president ofMcDonald's U.S. If customers do not want these ingredients, he said McDonald's should get rid of them.
No one knows if customers even care about the changes.
No one knows if customers even care about the changes.
Michael Jacobson is a food expert. He runs the Center for Sci-
ence in the Public Interest. The group wants people to eat safer
and healthier food. Jacobson said that McDonald's isn't dealing
with the real problem with restaurant food. The real problem is
too many calories. Calories from food supply the energy that

Michael Jacobson is a food expert. He runs the Center for Sci- ence in the Public Interest. The group wants people to eat safer and healthier food. Jacobson said that McDonald's isn't dealing with the real problem with restaurant food. The real problem is too many calories. Calories from food supply the energy that
fuels people's bodies. However, too many calories, or the wrong
kind of calories, can make people unhealthy and overweight.
fuels people's bodies. However, too many calories, or the wrong kind of calories, can make people unhealthy and overweight.
For instance, he said, McDonald's can use sugar instead ofhigh-
fructose corn syrup. However, sugar does not make burger buns
For instance, he said, McDonald's can use sugar instead ofhigh- fructose corn syrup. However, sugar does not make burger buns any healthier.
It is especially important for McDonald's to convince people it
serves healthy food. Many families go to McDonald's for its
Happy Meals. Parents want quick and inexpensive meals. They
also want their kids to eat healthy.

It is especially important for McDonald's to convince people it serves healthy food. Many families go to McDonald's for its Happy Meals. Parents want quick and inexpensive meals. They also want their kids to eat healthy.
The company is now making more money in the United States.
It began to sell more food after it announced in October that it
would serve breakfast all day. In April, May and June, though,
McDonald's still made more money, just not as much. People
may not be as excited about all-day Egg McMuffins as they

The company is now making more money in the United States. It began to sell more food after it announced in October that it would serve breakfast all day. In April, May and June, though, McDonald's still made more money, just not as much. People may not be as excited about all-day Egg McMuffins as they were last fall.
On Monday, a McDonald's chef showed reporters that he used
real eggs to make Egg McMuffins. The company wants to send
a message that it serves healthy food.
On Monday, a McDonald's chef showed reporters that he used real eggs to make Egg McMuffins. The company wants to send a message that it serves healthy food.
